div.p: Every web services request made to Numbler must be authenticated. This is true if the sheet is private (only you or people you have invited can access it) or public (anyone can access the spreadsheet). The only way to create a valid authentication header is with a Numbler access ID and secret key - anonymous access is not allowed.

In order use the Numbler web service you must create a Numbler account and then register for API access. Your email address must be verified before your API access ID will work properly. Once you register for an API access ID you will receive an email with your access ID and secret key.
Your access ID is 20 digits long and your secret key is 40 digits.
